member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.IFile
member.summary: Represents a file within the file system.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IFile.ReadAll
member.summary: Reads the entire contents of the file as a string.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IFile.WriteAll(System.String)
member.summary: Overwrites the entire contents of the file with the specified string.
member.param: The data to write to the file.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.IFile.Path
member.summary: The full path to the file.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IFile.ReadAllLines(System.String)
member.summary: Opens a text file, reads all lines of the file, and then closes the file.
member.param: The file to open for reading.
member.returns: A string array containing all lines of the file.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IFile.OpenRead(System.String)
member.summary: Opens an existing file for reading.
member.param: The file to be opened for reading.
member.returns: A read-only IFileStream on the specified path.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.IFileSystem
member.summary: Represents the file system.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IFileSystem.CheckFileExists(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether a file at the given path exists in the file system.
member.param: The full path to the file.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IFileSystem.DeleteFile(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the file specified by the given path.
member.param: The full path to the file.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.ITcpClient
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.Net.Sockets.TcpClient class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.ITcpClient.Connect(System.Net.IPAddress,System.Int32)
member.summary: Connects the client to a remote TCP host using the specified IP address and port number.
member.param: The System.Net.IPAddress of the host to which you intend to connect.
The port number to which you intend to connect.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.ITcpClient.GetStream
member.summary: Returns the network stream used to send and receive data.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.ITcpClient.Close
member.summary: Disposes this object instance and requests that the underlying TCP connection be closed.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.ITcpClient.Connected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the underlying Socket for the TcpClient class is connected to a remote host.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.ITcpClient.Available
member.summary: Gets the amount of data that has been received from the network and is available to be read.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.ITcpListener
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.Net.Sockets.TcpListener class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.ITcpListener.Pending
member.summary: Determines if there are pending connection requests.
member.returns: true if connections are pending; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.ITcpListener.AcceptTcpClient
member.summary: Accepts a pending connection request.
member.returns: A TcpClient used to send and receive data.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.ITcpListener.Start(System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts listening for incoming connection requests with a maximum number of pending connection.
member.param: The maximum length of the pending connections queue.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.ITcpListener.Stop
member.summary: Closes the listener.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.ITcpListener.Active
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the listener is actively listening for client connections.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.INetworkStream
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.Net.Sockets.NetworkStream class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.INetworkStream.CanRead
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the NetworkStream supports reading.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.INetworkStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an Int32, or -1 if at the end of the stream.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.INetworkStream.Read(System.Byte[]@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads data from the NetworkStream.
member.param: An array of type Byte that is the location in memory to store data read from the NetworkStream.
The location in buffer to begin storing the data to.
The number of bytes to read from the NetworkStream.
member.returns: The number of bytes read from the NetworkStream.
member.remarks: Note that parameter 'buffer' has been explicitly marked as a ref parameter, to allow correct mocking of this method with NMock2.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.INetworkStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes data to the stream.
member.param: An array of type Byte that contains the data to write to the stream.
The location in buffer from which to start writing data.
The number of bytes to write to the stream.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.INetworkStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current position in the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte.
member.param: The byte to write to the stream.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.IStreamWriter
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.IO.StreamWriter class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IStreamWriter.Close
member.summary: Closes the current StreamWriter object and the underlying stream.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IStreamWriter.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for the current writer and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying stream.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IStreamWriter.WriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a string followed by a line terminator to the text string or stream.
member.param: The string to write. If value is null, only the line terminator is written.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.IDateTime
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.DateTime structure, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.IDateTime.Now
member.summary: Gets a DateTime object that is set to the current date and time on this computer, expressed as the local time.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.IDateTime.UtcNow
member.summary: Gets a DateTime object that is set to the current date and time on this computer, expressed as the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.IOleDbConnection
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnection class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.IOleDbConnection.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string used to open a database.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IOleDbConnection.Open
member.summary: Opens a database connection with the property settings specified by the ConnectionString.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IOleDbConnection.Close
member.summary: Closes the connection to the data source.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.IOleDbCommand
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.Data.OleDb.OleDbCommand class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.IOleDbConnection.CommandText
member.summary: The SQL statement or stored procedure to execute. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.IOleDbConnection.State
member.summary: Gets the current state of the connection.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IOleDbConnection.ExecuteNonQuery
member.summary: Executes an SQL statement against the Connection and returns the number of rows affected.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.IConsole
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.Console class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IConsole.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the specified string value to the standard output stream.
member.param: The value to write.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IConsole.WriteLine
member.summary: Writes the current line terminator to the standard output stream.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IConsole.WriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the specified string value, followed by the current line terminator, to the standard output stream.
member.param: The value to write.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IConsole.Clear
member.summary: Clears the console buffer and corresponding console window of display information.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.IPerformanceCounterCategory
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterCategory class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IPerformanceCounterCategory.Exists(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the category is registered on the local computer.
member.param: The name of the performance counter category to look for.
member.returns: true if the category is registered; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IPerformanceCounterCategory.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the category and its associated counters from the local computer.
member.param: The name of the custom performance counter category to delete.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IPerformanceCounterCategory.Create(System.String,System.String,System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterCategoryType,ICounterCreationDataCollection)
member.summary: Registers the custom performance counter category containing the specified counters on the local computer.
member.param: The name of the custom performance counter category to create and register with the system.
A description of the custom category.
One of the PerformanceCounterCategoryType values.
An ICounterCreationDataCollection implementation that specifies the counters to create as part of the new category.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.IPerformanceCounter
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounter class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.IPerformanceCounter.RawValue
member.summary: Sets the raw, or uncalculated, value of this counter.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IPerformanceCounter.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the Component.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.IPerformanceCounterFactory
member.summary: Provides an abstraction for creation of System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounter objects, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IPerformanceCounterFactory.Create(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of an implementation of the FrameworkAbstraction.IPerformanceCounter interface.
member.param: The name of the performance counter category (performance object) with which this performance counter is associated.
The name of the performance counter.
true to access the counter in read-only mode (although the counter itself could be read/write); false to access the counter in read/write mode.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.ICounterCreationData
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.Diagnostics.CounterCreationData class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.ICounterCreationData.CreationData
member.summary: The real counter creation data underlying the abstraction.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.ICounterCreationDataFactory
member.summary: Provides an abstraction for creation of System.Diagnostics.CounterCreationData objects, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.ICounterCreationDataFactory.Create(System.String,System.String,System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterType)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of an implementation of the FrameworkAbstraction.ICounterCreationData interface.
member.param: The name of the counter, which must be unique within its category.
The text that describes the counter's behavior.
A PerformanceCounterType that identifies the counter's behavior.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.ICounterCreationDataCollection
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.Diagnostics.CounterCreationDataCollection class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.ICounterCreationDataCollection.Add(FrameworkAbstraction.ICounterCreationData)
member.summary: Adds an implementation of the ICounterCreationData interface to the collection.
member.param: An ICounterCreationData object to append to the existing collection.
member.returns: The index of the new ICounterCreationData object.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.ICounterCreationDataCollection.Collection
member.summary: The real counter creation data collection underlying the abstraction.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.IFileInfo
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.IO.FileInfo class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.IFileInfo.DirectoryName
member.summary: Gets a string representing the directory's full path.

member.name: P:FrameworkAbstraction.IFileInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the file.

member.name: T:FrameworkAbstraction.IFileStream
member.summary: Provides an abstraction of the System.IO.FileStream class, to facilitate mocking and unit testing.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IFileStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the current position of this stream to the given value.
member.param: The point relative to origin from which to begin seeking.
Specifies the beginning, the end, or the current position as a reference point for offset, using a value of type SeekOrigin.
member.returns: The new position in the stream.

member.name: M:FrameworkAbstraction.IFileStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a block of bytes from the stream and writes the data in a given buffer.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The byte offset in array at which the read bytes will be placed.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that number of bytes are not currently available, or zero if the end of the stream is reached.
